oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Carte de visite of Orlando M. Poe, Union topographical engineer
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Dressed in civilian clothes, this prewar image of Poe may have been done while he was at West Point, N.Y. CDV produced by Charles D. Fredricks & Co., 587 Broadway, New York. Capt. Poe was a key topographical engineer for Union forces operating in Tenn. and the Western Theatre, supervising the construction of bridges and fortifications and authoring many Civil War maps. In his capacity as chief engineer of the XXIII Corps, he was a crucial factor in the successful defense of Knoxville, Tennessee.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Poe, Orlando M.
